Reviews.Title: “Great if you want an expensive hostel”
Reviews.Author: Travellinger2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here under the illusion that it was an actual hotel, I wanted comfort, service, specifically peace and quiet. I paid a lot more for the room just having an ensuite, I was on the ground floor, spent the night being woken by the insanely loud thump thump of people coming and going on the stairs, talking and opening doors. Babies crying, even someone unzipping their bag. In the morning I was informed I was unable to check out a day early, after explaining my dissatisfaction. I came to Amsterdam to relax, not to be involved in a hostel situation, which can be achieved for a fraction if the price elsewhere. The tv was tiny, and up high, just like at hospitals, the room is tiny, the shower is cold and uninviting, after braving the stoney floored shower, which was a significant extra codt not to have to share, the hot water woukd not run, the wifi has to be constantly re accessed with passwords, decor is beyond dated, and the bed is horrendous. Extremely disappointed, and this has ruined my short trip over. If you want a hostel, stay somewhere cheap, if you want an actual hotel, don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “very small room”
Reviews.Author: Phil747
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here in december 2011. the hotel's in a good location, about fifteen minutes walk from leidseplein and rembrandt square and the hotel let us leave our case's in the baggage room on arrival. the hotel was very nice and staff very friendly. it was a shared clean bathroom on each floor but our double room was very small even by amsterdam standards, it was about 10ft square !! but if your looking for just a bed to climb in at night i suppose it doesn't matter.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gabi a
Reviews.Content: i stay at this hotel for one day.it is easy to fiind if you print a google map. the staff is great, helps you with info, the room is great. the breakfast is excelent for the money you pay. I like it and i recomand it to evrybody. to the center you have many trams (2-3 stations), take the day ticket, it is 7 euro and you can go evrywhere. the elevator works!!! Next year i think i will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Pros”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELDEB_10
Reviews.Content: Upon an early arrival, I was greeted by the owner. She was extremely pleasant and helpful. I arrived via train way before the check in time. She told me I could store my luggage in the luggage room till check in time, especially if I wanted to go sightseeing and not waste my time. I asked her if there was a bathroom I could use to freshen up and she told me, YES by all means it is on the 2nd floor. I was sooooo happy. There was a shower there that I could use and feel new and refreshed after a long train ride. What a nice lady no wonder she has such a great business. Also, there was a gent there at the reception named Sunjay and he was one of the most friendly polite desk clerks I have ever met in my life. He arranged my taxi to the airport as well as gave me the best tips for the attractions. He also helped me use the internet. A very kind man he was. The breakfast room was bright, clean and very roomy. They had about 3 ladies working in there making sure everything was in good order. The rooms were extremely small and the beds were very old and no bed frames they were on the floor and when you sat on the bed it was very lumpy and uncomfortable. However, the shower and the sink in the room was good. Also it is on a nice street so you can open the window and get fresh air. The BEST thing about the hotel was that it had an elevator in good working order and it has a neat and clean curb appeal. Also near the bus line and a nice park.; I felt very safe in the area. Other than the uncomfortable bed the place was nice. Although there is a very high step to get into the place they should have an extra step there so you dont have to step up so high.but this is part of being in Amsterdam, goes with the territory. The owner and her staff do a great job and I would go back there just because of the customer service I got from everyone there. I got lost in the city and when I called for directions back to the hotel they gave me excellent directions. Maybe by the next time I go they will have new mattresses in the rooms. All in all a great stay and a very safe and secure property I would reccommend this to travelers on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Mame21
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for two nights with a large party of girls. We had a triple room, very spacious and clean. Breakfast was ok, what you expect for the price. Staff spoke well English and were very helpfull. Location was good, near the Heineken experience and walkable to the centre. Two of the girls asked to change rooms as it was a little small, they were then offered a nicer room. Good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: zonk_69
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my short stay in this hotel. Everything was perfect, I could not ask for anything more for this price. Staff was extremely friendly. Room was was very clean and comfy. Hotel is about 30 minutes walk from the city centre and in a very quiet street, no noise at all. The only downside of this hotel are very thin walls but it was not a big problem for me, had no problem with sleep at nights. Buffet breakfast was actually quite nice. I would recommend this hotel for everyone for stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: Seekerus
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here for 3 nights. Through out our stay the staff were very friendly and were always more than happy to help us out. There were fresh flowers in our spacious room which my girlfriend really liked. Free Internet in room worked really well. Good breakfast buffet to help start the day. Would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A week-end stay in a good value hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: SWINDLES
Reviews.Content: Good points-Well situated ( Weterling circuit), clean, quiet street. Breakfast normal menu but everything was good quality and there was plenty.Staff very friendly and helpful. Downside- bedroom small but what you would expect for the price, expected shared bathroom but none on third floor where our room was had to go down to the second floor so watch out for that . Good for a week-end but not a longer stay

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Matthew S
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the quad room for one night. We stayed in another place near the red light district for two other nights, but wished we stayed here the whole time. Very nice neighborhood, quiet, a great play park for children across the street, tram stop right nearby. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “TOP SPOT”
Reviews.Author: TBF57
Reviews.Content: All front desk staff were friendly and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. Stayed 3 nights. We had a room for 3 and was very roomy.. As was the bathroom. We will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “budgetfriendly - small rooms”
Reviews.Author: prosfallout
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hostel with three friends, shared two double rooms. Biggest advantage is the price, its quite cheap to stay there (cause hostels are mostly 2-night booking only). Its clean, its allright, nothing much. wouldnt recommend it for a longer stay. the rooms are tiny and the double bed is squeezed between the walls, there is no walking space whatsoever. Showers are on the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: verfol2011
Reviews.Content: We liked everything about the hotel. The staff was really friendly and helpful. The room was clean as was the bathroom. It is also on a quiet street. The breakfast was good. If I were to go to Amsterdam again, I would be more than happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kailua1907
Reviews.Content: The hotel located 20 min walking distance from the center. The toilets are not good also the bath. Cleaning is also a problem! Cheap though

Reviews.Title: “Never ever, ever stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Emmajdunne
Reviews.Content: It's the most disgusting place with the most horrendous staff I've ever come across in the entire life. We only booked this hotel as we arrived on Queens Day and it was the only available accommodation..we now know why. On arrival we were booked in and given our key to the room over the road. the instant we opened the door we were greeted with the strongest stench of drains/eggs, that never left the room the whole stay. Beds were itchy and we all had bites in the morning, flea bites we are all sure. There was a sign at the front desk offering a late check out for 8 euros, we booked in for this, check out was at 11am, and we paid until 12. At 11am a man opened our door, without knocking, my friend and I were only in our underwear, and screamed that we were late checking out. From our bed, shocked, we said we had paid for a late check out, the man wouldn't leave the room for at least 10 minutes, it was awful. We obviously got straight up after he left and started to pack our bags, at 12 on the dot he again opened our door without knocking and said we had to leave very aggressively, my friend asked why he was being so rude and he told him to [...] off?! I have never in my life heard anything like this, we had paid to stay in the hotel and had not made any noise or bother. It was very strange. Of course we have complained to Bookings.com and we are awaiting their comments.

Reviews.Title: “My 2nd stay at this hotel was as good as the first!”
Reviews.Author: JKNordlie
Reviews.Content: I went back to Amsterdam and knew the only place I wanted to stay was at the Asterisk. Once again I had a very nice stay. Yes the rooms are tiny, but this is Amsterdam! The shared bathroom/shower was always clean and rarely occupied. The owners were EXTREMELY awesome, and on three separate occasions they went WAY out of their way to make sure our stay there was the best it could be. They are very good people. Breakfast in their very nice dining room was quite a treat, with lots of options of high quality foods. The only negative was at night the doors closing on their own were pretty loud. The steps are very steep in the aux building, but I lugged my heavy suitcases up without problem.

Reviews.Title: “If not for the friendly reception and staff, I would stay away”
Reviews.Author: prechiel
Reviews.Content: One of the things that we consider is the service. This Hotel has great service oriented staff. The girl on the receptionist was patient enough to show us two rooms so we can decide which one to take. And all other receptionist are as great. Now the rooms - it's spacious but it's old. As usual, it has carpets on it. We chose the rooms on the ground floor on the other building because the lift doesn't work enough. Bathroom needs a lot of renovation. But the location is great. We can walk around amsterdam. Heineken museum is nearby, as well as the Van Gogh museum. Pls. renovate your rooms.

Reviews.Title: “clean, well located, helpful staff, comfortable beds, good shower”
Reviews.Author: byebaby
Reviews.Content: The Asterisk hotel is well located a little east of the Rijksmuseum and within easy walking distance of plenty of restaurants and coffee shops, and near a tram stop. The staff are very freindly and helpful, room small but totally clean, with a big window that opens securely and a lovely view onto a tree lined courtyard, beds very comfortable. Shared bath immaculately clean, lots of hot water. Breakfast had a good choice of food and was good quality. No complaints, an excellent budget hotel, would definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend it”
Reviews.Author: AussieLady_11
Reviews.Content: Very good budget hotel, haven't got a clue what other travellers are talking about in their less positive descriptions. Room was good size for solo traveller and very clean. Bit annoying to have to traipse downstairs for the loo/shower but if that meant the room was cheaper then fine with me. Lovely sitting room for breakfats and very helpful staff. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value, Nice”
Reviews.Author: Irena111
Reviews.Content: Spend two nights in Amsterdam on the way back from overseas to US. This was one of the few affordable hotels in the city. The staff was helpful, the rooms very clean and nice, breakfast was good in a pleasant room. Walking distance to the major museums, canals. I recommend asking for building with a lift as the walk up is a charming narrow winding staircase(s).

Reviews.Title: “Unless you are on a tight budget, don't bother.”
Reviews.Author: Rednut
Reviews.Content: Very small 'double' room with the bed jammed into a corner. Shared bathroom, creaky and noisy wooden floors & stairwell (very steep too - be careful not to break your neck). There is an elevator, but room for two only, or one with luggage and it does not always work. The room has no beer fridge so if you want a drink, room temperature is your only option. Location is a stones throw from the Heineken Brewery, which is a fun 'experience'. Otherwise, a long walk or ten minute tram ride into the restaurant and red light district.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and close to the sights”
Reviews.Author: Pindsay
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel fairly last minute, wanted something fairly central but within out budget. we were very pleased. In a quiet little road in walking distance to all the sights and by some nice little bars it was just right for what we needed. The rooms are pretty small but it was clean and it had a lovely breakfast room. The staff are very very helpful both with their e-mail responses and while we were there. There is a kooky little luggage lift and clocks all over the hotel with various world times... Would recommend as a hotel close enough to the centre but not in all the hustle.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: Pirate63
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nigjts on our first trip to Amsterdam. Directions given, by tram, from Central Station were spot on. The service by staff at reception was very freindly and helpful. Location was excellent, being walking distance from several museums and other attractions. Tram stops, which made seeing amserdam a breeze, were only 2 min walk and provide several routes around the city, The room was small and basic but very clean and tidy, sink provided but shared bathroom which was not a problem. Breakfast was included and while different to what I would normally think of as breakfast was tasty and plenty of it. I would have no hesitation in recommending this Hotel to others as if we were to return to Amsterdam we would more than likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well located hotel with good service. Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: pepipox
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel located just outside the city center, in a nice, quiet, residential area. However, it is still within walking distance to all the attractions and the nightlife. The service is very good, the people are very friendly and will try to help you out in whatever you need. The rooms, albeit small, were clean and had basic amenities, including a small TV with good selection of channels. The rooms were cleaned daily. The breakfast was OK. The only bad detail is as other traveler commented, the stairs in the adjacent building are really steep, so it can be dangerous if you are not extra careful. Also be careful, the WIFI is NOT free as it seems on its webpage. You have to buy a 5 euros card per hour to be able to use it. The room price was somewhat expensive, but still reasonable for Amsterdam and the location. In conclusion, is a cheap, no-frills, very well located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic, no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: GracieDundee_UK
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, just outside the city centre in a nice quiet area. It is however very easy to walk to most parts of the city from this point and there are tram stops very close by. The room was very small, and basic but comfortable and I got good sleep whilst staying there. The main problem was that I was on the third floor of a house ajoining the main hotel and had to climb three very steep flights of stairs with my luggage unaided and it was frankly dangerous. The breakfast was fine but very basic with on hot food on offer. There is internet access at reception but it cost 50c for 10 minutes. Also had to pay to 'rent' the safe in my room which I didn't. If you are looking for a no frills, cheapish option in a good location and don't mind climbing a lot of stairs this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “a nice place”
Reviews.Author: sharazade78
Reviews.Content: very welcoming, pleasant and helpful staff. The room is clean, nice and quiet. . my room was much more than I expected -It's basic but comfortable enough. Ideal if you looking for a place that's away from the traffic and all city noise. Good location residential area, 10 minutes walk from the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Neighborhood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bradwana
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Asterisk with two friends for three nights last April and was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is located south of the city centre close to the Heineken brewery museum and is a stones throw from the nearest bus and tram stop. There is now a new annex on Den Texstraat adjacent to the main hotel where my friends were located. I stayed in a single room with a shared toilet on the second floor which is not suitable for elderly or disabled guests due to it's compact nature. In fact, I'm six foot tall and could only just turn around in the loo (a fact which my fellow travellers found hilarious). The small dining area is on the ground floor and was very busy during breakfast. Staff were friendly although English was a problem occasionally. For a short stay, The Asterisk is ideal. Better standard hotels are available for a price but with many travelers on a tight budget these days, small neighborhood hotels like this should not be overlooked.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel near center but price/quality rate a bit low”
Reviews.Author: prx187
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in that hotels and booked it from Internet. They send us to the next house where they have other rooms, but not elevators. You have to carry your 20 Kg luggages on these high stairs (you see your partner feet when you climb, do not forget your alpinism equipment (joke) ) The personnel is friendly and speaks english and french as well, but they always ask you to go to the breakfast (free if you pay cash) but it close at 9.30 which was too early for us. I do not like to wake up early during holidays... The service is not changing the sheets everyday and they knock at your door at 8.30... not really for romantic trip. The room was giving to the back of the street and was quiet all nights except the last one because a party was in the garden. The location is near the Heineken brouwery and not far from the center by tramway. I cannot recommend it for student as the price was a bit high. I would expect a better service / room for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, especially for being on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: JKNordlie
Reviews.Content: I was in Amsterdam for 3 nights by myself. As a recent college graduate, the price and other peoples reviews were what got me to book at this hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the rooms and public areas very clean and looked to be quite new. Sharing a bathroom was not an issue, it was always clean and I never ran into anyone. My single room was sort of small, but was not an issue, even with me being 6'6". The hotel has a 2nd group of 8 rooms across the street and half a block down, but the short walk to breakfast was not an issue. Location was great, only a short walk to the museums, and maybe 30 minutes to the city center. I would definitely reccomend this hotel to anyone looking to travel on a budget. It was well worth the 44 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: AmelieZH
Reviews.Content: I did not feel very welcomed; they have booked me in their other house in the street (so if you do a reservation my recommendation is to make sure you are in the main building) and nobody was helping me carrying the lugagge although I was on my own. The room was very small. I booked a shared toilett & shower which was on another floor and not clean at all! I was delayed for my check-out by 30 minutes which meant they have already blocked my card to enter the house and the guy at the reception came with me to the room and watched me doing my luggage - absolutely unacceptable behaviour!! Even though it was my fault for which I apologized - this is not professional at all! Location is good and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Better elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: PinchOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: I titled my review "Better elsewhere" because I think you could find a comparable hotel for the same or better price closer to the center of Amsterdam and save walking time. The quality was average but there is no way this place could get away with their prices in most cities. A room like this would cost much less in most U.S. cities. The grout in the shower creeped me out and it had a cheap plastic curtain from the Bates Motel. We were on the ground floor with walk-out sliding doors and floor to ceiling windows which would have been nice had we spent any time there during the day but they did not have light blocking curtains so you were awakened by the sun very early. They only had duvets on the beds so your choice was to sweat under the duvet or be too cold without the duvet, no top sheets. There was a door in our room that we assumed led to an adjoining room that was locked from the other side. Wrong!! One morning we were awoken early by housekeeping, a man, asking us, three single women in our pajamas, if he could come through and get to the other room (turned out to be storage) so he could get linens! No clock/alarm in the room. On the positive side the breakfast was included in the room rate and was quite good. The breakfast room was very pleasant. Make sure you get the breakfast included when you make you arrangements or else it is not included and you will have to pay for it or go elsewhere. The buildingis old and we were awokenboth lateat night and early in the morning by other guests cclomp, clomp, clomping up and down the stairway. Staff were pleasant. Best thing to do in Amsterdam: rent bikes and ride out into the country side. Little town of Monnickendam was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: Swari
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Amsterdam for six days for a conference. I booked the single room with private shower in the Asterisk hotel because it seemed to be a good price. The room was clean and breakfast was good. However I was very disappointed when I learned about the hotel's WiFi policy. Asterisk charged 5 Euros for using their WiFi for 1 hour, 20 Euros for 5 hours and 30 Euros for 10 hours. Alternatively you could use their computer in the lobby (50 Cents for 10 min). The WiFi connection was one of the reasons why I chose this hotel because I wanted to do some work from my hotel room. I have carried my labtop from London to Amsterdam only for this purpose. Fair enough if the hotel would charge a small fee for the WiFi but personally I find that 5 Euros for 1 hour is too much. I also think that the fee for their WiFi should be stated CLEARLY on their website. If you click 'Internet' on the Asterisk website at the moment it just says: 'From all our hotel rooms WiFi-internet access is possible. For usage, please contact the reception upon arrival.'

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay if you just want the basics”
Reviews.Author: caribbeantraveller01
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a spacious room which is part of the hotel but a couple doors down. Had my own toilet and bath.The great thing is it is close walking distance to the museums and just a 20 minute walk to downtown Amsterdam or you can take the trams which are in walking distance to the hotel. The only problem was it was a bit noisy at night as you heard people (other guests) coming in and out and stumping up the stairs. Also some construction noises early in the morning in the buildings next door. Very annoying! And not many good channels on the tv to choose from. But the service is good, the breakfast is OK but the proximity to trams and museums make it a great, economical place to stay for a few days. It's ideal if you want no frills attached.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel that's great value - a short ride/walk to the Dam”
Reviews.Author: tristesse_sg
Reviews.Content: After our brief encounter with a shoebox in Paris, we were most delighted with the spacious, bright and airy room (a comfortable size for three) when we arrived at Hotel Asterisk. We thoroughly appreciated its location on a quiet residential street near Weteringcircuit - certainly a relief from the hustle and bustle of Damrak. Yet it's minutes (by tram) or several longer minutes (by foot) to Dam Square, the Van Gogh Museum, Rijksmuseum, Albert Cuypstraat (great buys to be found there), and several other sights. Breakfast was included and despite the hungry crowd descending into the breakfast room each morning (avoid 9-10am if you like it quiet), the staff always remained unruffled and cheery. Without a doubt, Hotel Asterisk was one of the best hotels amongst the five we experienced in the four European cities we visited - the helpful and friendly staff were also a big plus. We'll certainly stay at Hotel Asterisk again when we're next in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jasna86
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Asterisk during Queensday and it was great! Rooms are nice, clean and large enough. The only problem was, that you are not allowed to smoke in the room and there wasn't any balcony, but we managed:) It's in a beautifull small quiet street across the canal from Heineken in a walking distance to all the atractions. Staff was very nice and helpfull, breakfast was also good, so that we were pleasantlly surprised and will definetelly comme back.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place but cleaners need to do a better job”
Reviews.Author: kiwilankan
Reviews.Content: The good things about this hotel are that itâ€™s in a quiet location of Amsterdam but within walking distance to many of the attractions. A couple of different tram lines also stop nearby to take you to attractions further afield. The breakfast which was included in the rate was also good in that there was quite a bit of variety (although a toaster for the bread would have made it better!) and the people at the reception were also friendly. We stayed in a room in the building a couple of doors down from the main building and our own bedroom and sink but the bathroom was shared. We never had to wait for the bathroom and hardly ever saw any other guests so didnâ€™t have any problems with the sharing. However, the cleaners had not kept any soap to wash our hands with in the bathroom (this was the same for our sink also). We werenâ€™t expecting free shower gel or shampoo, but thought it was really bad of them to not even provide any soap for the shared bathrooms or for the sinks in the rooms. I went and checked out another shared bathroom also and it was the same case there. Our beds were never made although it was evident that the cleaner had come into the room as she had moved a couple of things around, we thought this was very strange! Also the room was tiny with 2 single beds instead of a double bed, but this wasnâ€™t a huge issue for us as we put the 2 beds together and at least the room was quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and very helpful!”
Reviews.Author: krissls
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my family on 22nd March, 2009 for 2 days and it was a great stay. The reception was very helpful and informative. The rooms are clean, spacious and he even arrange the rooms at ground floor so that my parents don't have to climb up the stairs. I really appreciate that. The location is good, just short walking distance to catch a tram to the city center. And also not forget, great breakfast in the morning! I will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem-amazing price and Very clean!”
Reviews.Author: Gemi_9
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little b and b in Amaterdam!It is very clean and the rooms are lovely! It is located right next to a tram stop and the Heineken brewery and also the Van Gogh museum and also the Hard Rock Cafe which are all within walking distance. It is a quiet hotel on a little street and you rarely are disturbed by other guests. If you are the type of person who prefers a luxurious hotel with a big lift and stairs reconsider but with breakfast included at this price and in this location we Loved it! Great for young people!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Fantastic staff and brilliant breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: miximatch
Reviews.Content: Very friendly, helpful and informative staff on reception. Breakfast was varied, tasty and filling with helpful staff. Great location for walking to attractions and very quiet at night. Supermarket for organic goods only 10 minutes walk away, as well as cheap local market and park. Room was basic and clean. I was concerned about sharing toilet and shower outside of room, but never encountered a problem and they were clean. I Will most definitely come back again with friends and family. Take the lift if you have mobility issues as the stairs are very steep - I actually found them quite intriguing!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Julie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well situated and provided a good breakfast in the rate. The wireless internet was expensive and would have liked maybe 1 other english speaking channel on the TV other than a news station but we could live with that. The area was safe with every thing in walking distance. Would consider again if returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: AucklandMary
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated in Amsterdam, near the markets, Art gallerles, cafes, night life and an easy walk to the shops. The receptionist was very friendly and helpful. Explained how we could park our car at a park and ride for 6 euro per 24 hours with a choice of free bikes or free tram tickets. Our room was in another house down the street - but we were pleased with our bed and bathroom. The decor was pleasant, and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was good with nice bath linen. Breakfast was down the road back at the hotel. The food served was typical dutch with boiled eggs, ham, cheese, rolls, fruit bread, and good selection of jams /spreads, coffee, teas, and fruit juice. We thought value for money was excellant and would book this hotel again next time we visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Elparaiso
Reviews.Content: Positives were friendly and helpful staff, an adequate continental breakfast, proximity to some of the many Amsterdam museums and restaurants, clean rooms with adequate space (we were in what is titled a deluxe double with en suite). Negatives were a lack of hot water one morning (cold shower brrrr), a sink that drained verrrry slowly and being a little further from the centre of Amsterdam than I would prefer, but I knew that when I booked so tough! Price is also a negative for me as it was expensive for what it was, but then that is only in comparison with almost every other city I have stayed in. Given Amsterdam prices it was a bargain. Stairs are very steep, but I found them more amusing than a problem. Thank goodness for the poky wee lift as it would have been a nightmare lugging luggage up and down the stairs!

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet!”
Reviews.Author: supersnazz
Reviews.Content: The two of us stayed at this hotel from May 13-15, 2008. It is a short tram ride away from Centraal Station and is located in a quiet part of town. The hotel itself occupies a number of buildings. The room we stayed in was not in the same building as the concierge. Our room was on the top floor (5th?). To access it, we had to climb a narrow, winding staircase with steep steps. Our room was fairly large and had a beautiful, large window that was on the back of the hotel and faced neighbours' gardens. The room was clean, simple, and comfortable. The bathroom contained a shower, but not a tub. We were both amazed at how quiet the surrounding area was. We slept with the window wide open and were not disturbed once. The room did not have air conditioning. The breakfast was basic (juice, yoghurt, cereal, milk, toast, cheese, cold cuts, coffee, tea) and did the trick! The front desk staff were helpful and courteous. The vending machine contained beer, which was handy, as the room did not come with a fridge. The hotel is close to the arts district, lots of restaurants, and a few shops. It's about a 20 minute walk up toward the more tourist-oriented centre. We enjoyed the walk and the fact that we didn't have to sleep in that area. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Clean and Quiet ... Great service.”
Reviews.Author: AKFromColorado
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights mid May 2008. (was there previously 2 years prior). Still great, friendly staff -- once you get situated in the city, the (long) walk to the city center is beautiful and full of food, beer, shopping and other things Amsterdam-esque ... On a quiet street, clean and safe. However -- I knew I was booking a budget hotel. This is a GREAT budget hotel. It is NOT a Hilton nor anything luxurious. The rooms are typically small for Europe, and the stairs are steep (but there is a lift/elevator). The breakfast, included with the room is quite simple, but nice for budget traveling. Feel free to reply directly if you'd like more info... AK

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: rainmar
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights and loved it! The staff is very helpful, always smiling, and really make guests feel at home. My room was comfortable, the bathroom was clean and hot water was plentiful. The TVs and comfy pillows are much appreciated after a long days of sightseeing and museum hopping. (Speaking of which, the location is great! Easy walk to Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh, and 2 tram stops to the Anne Frank House (a must see).) I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: moorek
Reviews.Content: This is a 2 star hotel - so that's what you should expect - but the location was perfect, the staff was extremely helpful and I certainly felt that I got my money's worth. Yes - rooms are small and the building is quite old - but you're in Amsterdam. There is a lift in the building I was in, which is good since the stairs are almost treacherous. The worst part was the other guests coming in at all hours of the night from the "coffeeshops." I would definitely stay here again if I could only afford a 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for More !”
Reviews.Author: uv83
Reviews.Content: Me and My girlfriend stayed in Hotel Asterisk for 4 nights. I still can't believe it was available and only about 110 euros per night for both of us. The staff was fabulous, the room was neat everyday and breakfast was good. Asterisk is located near Museumsplein, 5 minutes walk to rijksmuseum. it is also not far from leidsplein (We walked there). We recommend a tour to Heineken Museum across the street, and the pancake house infront of the hotel. Asterisk is a good bargain. we would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect quality for money ratio”
Reviews.Author: Anton_and_Olga
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Hotel Asterisk for six days during Christmas. It was absolutely great experience for us. It was partly business|private trip and the hotel suited both means the best. Fist of all, we admire the friendly attitude of the staff. Always smiling and very helpful. Rooms are clean and tidy. Breakfast good enough. Absolutely nice, authentic Dutch building with the huge and narrow stairs (if you are traveling with bags - you can use an elevator) and great cosy atmosphere. Close to city center. The only minus is a little bit spartan conditions of living: just only essential things, nothing extra. But for two stared hotel it is extra already! So if you travel to Amsterdam and wanna make a smart choice, we highly recommend hotel Asterisk.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: GEOHannover
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel, a little old from deco and with a steeeeep stair, clean, very friendly and quiet that it will suit people who can pay only the basics but in its best form. Centrum and basic museums at walking distance (although it was -4C!!).

Reviews.Title: “Asterisk Is A-OK”
Reviews.Author: brittyandthecity
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Amsterdam for 2 nights during a trip within a trip when I was in London for 2 weeks in October. I did a lot of research and was surprised at how pricey a simple B&B was - but I didn't want to stay somewhere unsafe/sketchy just to pay less money either. Eventually I came across the Asterisk through Trip Advisor and decided that it sounded okay for the price. Overall I enjoyed the Asterisk - it is a no-frills hotel, and I stayed in the no-frills budget rooms in the annex building located a couple of doors over from the main building. The check-in service was great and prompt, and everyone was really nice and friendly. We went back a few times to ask questions and they were relatively helpful, although we couldn't figure out how to use the trams (legally) and they weren't much help in that department. Be warned that you are expected to pay for your room as soon as you walk in the door! The rooms aren't particularly huge, nor are they decorated. The budget rooms have a sink in your room which is nice, plus a shared bathroom between 4 rooms - but I never once ran across someone else using the bathroom so that wasn't a problem. I believe there is a breakfast buffet of some sort but it wasn't clearly spelled out as to whether it was free or cost 10 euros so we skipped it. In terms of complaints, I had a couple. The staircase leading up to the rooms in the annex building really was insane. I thought people were exaggerating about its narrowness, but no - it was almost like climbing a ladder. I had fun with it - but if you're older or have difficulty with stairs this is probably a scary prospect. Also, to get into my room you had to get into it by entering through another door which led to two different room doors (mine and another). All 3 of these doors were INSANELY loud and squeaky - luckily neither of us seemed to come in very late so we didn't get woken up in the middle of the night. The pros to this place - the location is really nice. It's quiet and peaceful, and right by a few of the attractions including the (fun) Heinekin Museum, The Rijksmuseum, and the Van Gogh Museum. Really though, Amsterdam is an extremely walkable town. If you've never been, I'd recommend the 12 euro shuttle, but once you're a bit more familiar with the town you'll find walking (or shuttling) to Central Station and taking a train is way cheaper and more efficient. Also, you happen to be right near the Pancake Carousel - which I highly recommend. The Poffertjes are the best! Overall I think if I went back I'd look into other places that maybe offered a few more amenities for the price (although 80 euros a night isn't bad) but I wouldn't mind staying at the Asterisk again.

Reviews.Title: “Scarey hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jerseymick
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for one night on the way back from Berlin, we only wanted a crash and the price looked ok. We booked a treble room which turned out to be a double and a camp bed. The room was in a building next store, top floor no lift and very dangerous stairs even for Amsterdam standards, no fire escape from our room, the only way down was down them 90 degree stairs or out the window. The room was ok but the shower was filthy and togeher with the vermon traps under the bed we left and booked into another hotel which compared to this was a palace. I don't know what the main hotel building was like but the top rooms in the house next door are a danger for older people and young children

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: 65bus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really quite good. The Reception area is tight but the staff were professional and helpful. The elevator is the small closet type so 1 person and maybe 2 suitcases can fit but thats about it. We had a delux room on the 4th floor facing the backside of the building. The room was large enough and the bathroom was very large with a seperate bath and shower. The bed was comfortable as well. The room are not modern but are clean and nice. The TV was one of the smallest I have ever seen, but you don't really go to Amsterdam to watch TV in your room. The location of the hotel is on a residential street so its nice and quiet. Public transporr is a block or so away so you can get to the action very quickly. It is close to RijkMuseum and the Heiniken Experience. Breakfast is included and is ok. Typical European continental. I would definitly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Asterisk!”
Reviews.Author: travelbee4
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! The Hotel Asterisk is fairly small, but what they lack in size they make up for in character. The hotel has a great location near several major museums, and is not far from nightlife either (but far enough that you can't hear it at night). One thing that was quite nice is that this hotel is completely drug free (unlike some), meaning that no drug-taking is to take place on the premises. They take this very seriously. The rooms are nice and clean, many with private bathrooms (all the bathrooms were nice and clean as well) and ours had a balcony (no view though, we were' on the first floor). The hotel has a large breakfast room, where they serve a fairly traditional continental breakfast. But the best part of the hotel was the staff. They were all openly friendly and extremely helpful. One woman in particular did all she could to assist my friend in a bike-rental-place-took-my-passport scenario. They were all very nice, I repeat, very nice, and willing to chat away at all hours.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: UkAndie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Feb 07. Was meeting up with friends for a night out in the 'Dam but no-one lives locally so it was a cheap bed for the night and was excellent value. Very clean, very well run place. Strict no drugs policy (incl. weed, etc.) keeps it that way. Contrary to popular belief most of us Nederlanders don't smoke weed so it's nice avoid the drug tourists Single rooms are on the small side but I've stayed in worse at over double the price in lesser cities (e.g. Utrecht, Maastricht). Amazing value for the price - why anyone would contemplate a hostel is beyond me as the price is not much more than a dorm room... (unless your sole purpose of coming to NL is to smoke weed: if so you're missing the real NL) Highly, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, warm and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Paulaian
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there with a group of friends, (8 of us)for four days. It is set in a quiet street away from all the hurly burly. It is a short walk to all shops , good food and night life. Also around the corner is a good supply of trams to take you all over the city. The room was large with a good sized bathroom, and we were one of the lucky ones to have a balcony. The breakfast had a variety of cold meats cheeses, pates, cerials and much more. Recomend this hotel to anyone, and we would certainly stay there again. A good value for money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, and lovely”
Reviews.Author: Ericasigmar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Asterisk for four days and thought it was fantastic. The rooms weren't large, but the size was just fine for two people and very very clean. We were only ever in the room for sleeping, so it was perfect. The various people working at reception were very nice and the breakfast was healthy and sizeable. the stairs were extremely steep and the lift was ancient, so I would not recommend the hotel to infirmed guests. The location was so great as it is around the corner from the Henekien Brewery, a 10 minute walk to the Leidesplein, and 15 to the Rembrandtplein. The prices are cheaper on the hotel website than on any budget hotel websites, so we saved 20 euro. We had a shared bathroom, and while not convenient, the shower was clean and we only had to use the bathrooms on other floors a few times. The street was very quiet and the houses on the block have gorgeous interiors (I'm a bit nosy...), but the construction was still going on down the street, though it wasn't too loud. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who does not mind a small room and steep stairs!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff, but the construction in the neigborhood is noisy”
Reviews.Author: Green_Backpack
Reviews.Content: The location is pretty good as the Tram lines are very close to the hotel. The hotel staff is also very helpful and friendly. The only downsides I had with my experience there was the fact that two buildings down from Hotel Asterisk there is some very noisy construction going on. The jack hammers and chainsaws started around 7:30 am and continued through out the day. If I wasn't on holiday this of course wouldn't be an issue but it's nice to sleep in on occasion, right? Other than this the single room that I stayed in was very clean but had a dormitory-esque feel to it. Nothing flashy, just the basics. If you do decide on this hotel call ahead to confirm that the construction has been completed if the noise will be a problem for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: PinkNFluffy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a recommendation from someone in the family. It was a basic hotel - in fact, not much more than a bed & breakfast really, but it was clean and the staff were friendly. Basic continental breakfast, but the bedroom had tea/coffee making facilities and en-suite toilet/shower room. Our room was in a building a couple of doors up the street, which was a little obscure but not a problem. The hotel itself is situated just outside the centre of the city, but it is only a short walk into central Amsterdam. There are a lot of excellent eateries around the area (including a pancake place, but that was always shut - which was annoying)!! The Heineken Factory is just over the canal, which is brilliant!! I don't drink lager, but I loved the place (plus you get free beer)!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Palce”
Reviews.Author: Mum47summer
Reviews.Content: Came back from here last week and for the price we paid it was excellent. Although not designer interiors it was clean and spacious. Breakfast was excellent seeing as it was free if you paid cash for room and it set us up for the day. Our room was large and clean. Bedding was clean and white and bathroom was clean. The staff were very friendly and it was close to all amenities (tram, canal taxi, museums) and easy walking distance to city centre. The pancake house round the corner is a must, as is the nearby market. The only downside to the hotel was that the weather was very hot whilst we were there but we were unable to open the room windows more than a few inches as the radiators were in the way! Next time I would ask for one of the rooms with a small balcony. The stairs are steep but there was a lift if needed. We loved our stay in Amsterdam and would come again to the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Get Rid of the Hater”
Reviews.Author: Multitraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night, having difficulty getting room. Nice big twin room on quiet street. Breakfast the next morning was basic fare, made less by nasty blonde server who seemed intent on putting down American in front of Dutch diners. I was polite and checked out soon, told later by local that some areas of the city do not like Americans.A less rating given by this experience, but not a bad hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Steepest stairs ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Irishchelle
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed here for six nights in april 06, on first impressions of the hotel looked good, its located on a side street, in a mainly residential area, and is noticeably quiet. The hotel is divided into 2 building, the main building has a lift, but the one we stayed in didnt. Tthe stairs were the steepest ive ever seen, dangerous in fact! I'm asmathic and we were staying on the 2nd floor and each time i climbed it i nearly coughed up a lung!, the stairs are difficult to climb and to bring luggage up and down. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the rooms are serviced daily.Rooms are clean but we booked a double room and we got a room with 2 single beds pushed side by side, with very bad mattress' that never stayed on the bed.Above our room we had an apartment and could here the going on's of the residents, ie showers been taken, walking across the floor and even the going on;s in the bedroom which i really didnt wanna hear!!! Trams near by bring u to the dam square and other local attractions. The strip of tickets can be bought cheaply from the hotel reception. Breakfast was decent typical dutch food, meat, bread, cheese, cereal and fruit. I had booked the hotel through my travel agent but if i had the choice i wouldnt stay there again unless i was guaranteed to be in the building with the lift!!! Because of the stairs its not suitable to eldery, children or astmatics or disabled people

Reviews.Title: “Escape the tourist ghetto”
Reviews.Author: Blacklisted
Reviews.Content: We were given a small room with a double bed with its side to the wall - it was too small, we tried a room with two single beds instead and they were a lot better. The staff were easy to talk to and helpful. Even if you are a couple, book a twin room to avoid the cramped double. The view onto the street is superb and reflects traditional Amsterdam archetecture. The breakfast facilities are good and as the area is away from the touristy Dam Square, you can get food nearby at reasonale prices. Van Woustraat contains many cheap places to eat. There is a wonderful market nearby on Albert Cuypstraat. There is only one other hotel on the same street, the rest is residential. There are very few cars at night. Watch out for the stairs - they are the steepest we ever saw. There is a lift in one part of the hotel but not in the other. Near Rijks and van Gogh museums. Easy to catch trams from or walk if you are half fit.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic hotel in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: msavaria
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a one-night lay-over in Amsterdam. Since we wouldn't be spending much time in the room, we looked for something not too expensive. We also wanted a room close to the museums so we could go to one before checking out in the morning. Our room was relatively large and clean. There were a few chairs, a table, a desk, and storage furniture to put your clothes away. The windows were large, could be opened, and afforded a view of the courtyard. The room was quiet and equipped with a television and telephone. Ours was called a deluxe, twin room. The "twin" refers to the two twin beds pushed together. The "deluxe" part probably referred to the room's large size and the shower (I think some rooms had only a tub.) The room was basic -- nothing fancy or attractive. The walls were cement-like -- reminiscent of those in dorm rooms. The mattresses were not very firm, but O.K. for one night. The sheets were heavy and smelled fresh. The bathroom was immaculate with well-working fixtures and nice tile. There was complimentary soap, shampoo, and shower gel. There was good security. (A card had to be used for the outside door, a door to the area of our floor that the room was in, and the room's door.) The breakfast room was very attractive. The breakfast was typically Dutch -- nothing special (cereals, breads, cheese, and meats), but the coffee was good. The staff was very helpful and friendly. A plus for this hotel was its use of the Connexxion hotel shuttle service, which is very convenient, and though it seems pricey, saves money and/or aggravation when compared to cab/train or tram/train. The person at the desk booked our return ride when we checked in and printed out a confirmation on the computer printer. Our ride to the hotel was the typical hotel shuttle ride with other travelers stopping at other hotels, but the ride to the airport was a private luxury van ride with a friendly, talkative driver. Another plus was proximity to the museums and the canal bus. My main complaint was that we stayed in the annex, which smelled of smoke, as did our room. I am not sure whether there are designated non-smoking rooms (Amsterdam has many smokers.) For anyone looking for something basic, clean, convenient, safe, and inexpensive, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended, despite the positive reviews elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: Alternatives
Reviews.Content: Paid for a triple room and then hotel staff tried to charge us even more because we used the extra bed. We used the extra bed because the mattress on the double bed was so worn two people couldn't sleep in it without rolling into each other. The breakfast was meagre and the staff stingy. The overall feel of this hotel is cheap with just enough decoration to pass for something like a 1-star hotel. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-2nd stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Supline
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Asterisk. The first was in 2001. It appears that they have updated the rooms since the last stay. We were in a room with a shared bathroom. This means that the toilet and shower are in the hall and shared with one other room. The rooms that share the bathroom still have a sink in the room. The rooms are on the small side, but this is fairly common in Amsterdam. Even with the small size they had ample closet space, and good table/shelf space. If you pay with cash breakfast is included. Breakfast is mainly breads and rolls, butter, cheese, lunch meat, coffee and juice. It wasn't the best breakfast and we started skipping the hotel food and going out into the city after the second or third day. This hotel has a friendly staff, an elevator which is great for getting your bags up to your room, and is in a great location. The hotel is close to several tram lines, is in a quiet residential neighborhood, and is within a pleasent walking distance of the museum quarter. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and close to the famous museums (Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Quiet and close to the famous museums (Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum) Stay from April 20 to April 23, 2005: the hotel is located close to the famous museums at approximately 35 minutes at foot of the rail station, in a street quiet and attended well. Our room was located in the annexe on the 2nd floor (very stiff staircase). We divided the shower and the WC with another room but apparently it was free thus no problem to reach it. We had two simple beds and a washbasin in the room. Good bedding and clean room with simple but neat decoration. Breakfast included in the price if cash payment. Large choice for breakfast. Welcoming and helpful staff. In conclusion : An hotel at an accessible price (65 euros per night), quiet and clean. We are delighted by our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Happy travelers!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Asterisk. They were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was great. Very small, but clean and comfortable room. We shared a clean bathroom with one other room, and we never even had to see or wait for the other people. We would return in a heartbeat. Great for the budget traveler who enjoys quality and doesn't want a party atmosphere. Ask for a first floor room if you have trouble with stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: MoodControl
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay. I will be booking this hotel again next time I am in Amsterdam. Clean room great shower. Breakfast food is nothing special but is filling and tasty. Helpfull front desk.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Asterisk
HotelInfo.Address: Den Texstraat 16, Amsterdam 1017 ZA, The Netherlands
